intro: Thunbergia diplocalymma, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments.
